text: Humanistic Judaism is a kind of Judaism that does not focus on God or religion. Instead, it is about Jewish culture and history. People who believe in Humanistic Judaism may not believe in a god, but they are still connected to being Jewish. Judaism is based on human thinking and actions, showing how human responsibility and the ability to make choices that affect a lot of people in the world is important. == References == Category:Jewish denominations Category:Humanism Category:Secularism
title: Humanistic Judaism
